meanings.definition: To attract or tempt someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The shiny object allures the curious cat.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful music allures many listeners.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies allures people to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious forest path allures adventurers seeking treasure.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the flowers allures butterflies to the garden.

meanings.definition: The power to attract or charm.
meanings.sent1: The allures of the city include its bustling streets and tall buildings.
meanings.sent2: She possessed a natural allure that captivated everyone she met.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks had a magical allure that amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The old bookstore had a nostalgic allure for those who loved to read.
meanings.sent5: The starlit sky held a mysterious allure that made people gaze in wonder.
